page.title: 03The OLD LANTERN Public House
page.content: The{"Old Lantern"}is situated in the village of Martin and is owned by {Christine Carr,}who has been the Landlady for nine years. She previously owned a betting shop in London. There is a large garden with tables and chairs and a purpose built playhouse for children. Mrs Carr says that her clientele come from as far away as Ramsgate, Broadstairs and Hythe, and that few villagers use the pub. She employs nineteen employees on a part-time rota, including kitchen staff and she also cooks. The opening hours are from 10.30am to 2.30pm and from 6.30pm to 11pm on Mondays to Saturdays and on Sundays from 12pm to 2pm and 7pm to 10.30pm. Bitter beer is the most popular drink sold here. There is one bar.
